get.description:
### JSON API compatibility divergence

#### Filters
In JSON API standard (https://jsonapi.org/recommendations/#filtering) one can request elements with multiple
filter values by simply providing them separated by coma:

`variables?filter[variable_type]=url,constant`

This notation will not work here. You can achieve this functionality by providing multiple filters for the same parameter:

`variables?filter[variable_type][]=url&filter[variable_type][]=constant`

parameters.name: page[limit]
parameters.description: Limits the number of returned items

parameters.name: page[offset]
parameters.description: Sets offset for list of items

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Comma-separated sort list with given attributes: name, variable_type, created_at, updated_at

builtin.description: Flag indicating whether variable is custom or builtin

is_published.description: Flag describing whether variable is published (true) or not published (false)

code.description: An application-specific error code, expressed as a string value.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

source.description: An object containing references to the source of the error.

pointer.description: A JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the associated entity in the request document.

parameter.description: A string indicating which URI parameter caused the error.

meta.description: An object containing additional application-specific information about error.
